case_vignette:
A 55-year-old man is brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after the sudden onset of severe, migrating anterior chest pain, shortness of breath, and sweating at rest. He has hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Medications include atorvastatin, hydrochlorothiazide, lisinopril, and metformin. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 25 years. He is in severe distress. His pulse is 110/min, respirations are 20/min, and blood pressure is 150/85 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 98%. Cardiac examination shows a grade 3/6, high-pitched, blowing, diastolic murmur heard best over the right sternal border. The lungs are clear to auscultation. Femoral pulses are decreased bilaterally. An ECG shows sinus tachycardia and left ventricular hypertrophy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? 
A) Acute coronary syndrome
B) Acute aortic dissection
C) D) Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
D) Acute pulmonary embolism
E) Acute myocardial infarction
F) Aortic regurgitation
G) Cardiac tamponade
H) Pulmonary hypertension
I) Pulmonary edema
J) Pulmonary embolism
K) Pulmonary hypertension
L) Pulmonary thromboembolism
M) Pulmonary valve stenosis
N) Pulmonary valve stenosis
O) Pulmonary valve stenosis
P) Pulmonary valve stenosis
Q) Pulmonary valve stenosis
R) Pulmonary valve stenosis
S) Pulmonary valve stenosis
T) Pulmonary valve stenosis
U) Pulmonary valve stenosis
V) Pulmonary valve stenosis
W) Pulmonary valve stenosis
X) Pulmonary valve stenosis
Y) Pulmonary valve stenosis
Z) Pulmonary valve stenosis
A) Acute coronary syndrome
B) Acute aortic dissection
C) Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
D) Acute pulmonary embolism
E) Acute myocardial infarction
F) Aortic regurgitation

I'm experiencing severe chest pain that moves around, difficulty breathing, and sweating.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for about 30 minutes.

Yes, I have hypertension, high cholesterol, and type 2 diabetes.

I'm sorry, but I don't have information about my family history of heart disease or cardiovascular events to share.

The chest pain is severe and migrating.
Have you taken any medications since the onset of symptoms?
No, I have not taken any medications since the symptoms started.
Final Diagnosis: Acute Coronary Syndrome
